title: Stones River National Battlefield: Park Home
body: A Hard Earned Victory  The Battle of Stones River began on the last day of 1862 and was one of the bloodiest conflicts of the Civil War. The battle produced important military and political gains for the Union, and it changed forever the people who lived and fought here. Read More             Making A "National" Park Service   Help us celebrate the National Park Service Centennial as we examine the crucial events of  1933 that truly made the NPS a national entity.            History & Culture   Learn about the many layers of history found in the park's landscapes and collections.        Nature   Learn more about the unique natural resources and ecosystems that make up the battlefield.              Interpretive Programs   Check out the array of talks, walks, tours and special events presented by employees, volunteers and partners.        Volunteer Opportunities   There no better way to Find Your Park than through volunteering. Check out all of the ways you can make a difference.        Friends of Stones River NB   Support our preservation and interpretation efforts by joining the Friends of Stones River National Battlefield.
